alert.note: Alert for Henry; Patrick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 4:02PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Surry, northwestern Stokes, central Henry and southern Patrick Counties and the City of Martinsville through 430 PM EDT... At 402 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Figsboro to Mount Airy. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Martinsville... Mount Airy... Flat Rock... Stuart... Francisco... Spencer... and Ararat. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
